description: Use ensemble models in binary classification tasks to improve accuracy.
rationale: Ensemble models combine the predictions of multiple models, which can help to correct for overfitting and improve the overall accuracy of the predictions.
notes: site: Kaggle Discussions | author: Chris Deotte | tacit: True

description: Prioritize feature engineering over model tuning in binary classification tasks.
rationale: Feature engineering, the process of creating new input variables from your existing ones, often has a larger impact on the performance of a machine learning model than tuning its parameters. This is because new features can expose new dimensions of the data to the model, allowing it to make more accurate predictions.
notes: site: Kaggle Discussions | author: Chris Deotte | tacit: True

description: Use ensemble methods in binary classification tasks to improve model performance.
rationale: Ensemble methods combine predictions from multiple models to produce a final prediction, often resulting in improved accuracy and robustness compared to single models.
notes: site: Kaggle Discussions | author: Chris Deotte | tacit: True
